org.jcatapult.mvc.result.control
Interface Control

All Superinterfaces:
freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel, freemarker.template.TemplateModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractButtonInput, AbstractCheckedInput, AbstractComponentControl, AbstractControl, AbstractInput, AbstractListInput, AbstractValueInput, ActionMessages, Button, Checkbox, CheckboxList, CountriesSelect, FieldMessages, File, Form, Hidden, Image, Message, MonthsSelect, Password, RadioList, Reset, Select, Submit, Text, Textarea, YearsSelect
public interface Control
extends freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel

This interface defines a control is called from a JSP tag library or from a FreeMarker template to render some HTML or other type of output.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Fields inherited from interface freemarker.template.TemplateModel

 void renderEnd(Writer writer)
          Renders the end of the control.

Methods inherited from interface freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel
execute
 

Method Detail

renderStart

void renderStart(Writer writer,
                 Map<String,Object> attributes,
                 Map<String,String> dynamicAttributes)
Renders the start of the control. If the control doesn't have a start and an end, this method should be empty.

Parameters:
writer - The writer to write the output to.
attributes - The attributes that are passed from the JSP tag or the FreeMarker directive.
dynamicAttributes - The dynamic attributes that are passed to the tag. These are described in the class comment of the ParameterWorkflow class. In most cases these are used for type conversion, such as date formats and currency codes.

renderEnd

void renderEnd(Writer writer)
Renders the end of the control. If the control doesn't have a start and an end, this method should be perform the main rendering.

Parameters:
writer - The writer to write the output to.
